---
title: "Teaching"
---

I am teaching the following courses at Carnegie Mellon University (order by course level):

#### 46--924 Natural Language Processing (mini)

Elective course on natural language processing for the [Master's in Computational Finance program](https://www.cmu.edu/mscf/), text mining, topic models, and transformers.

#### 46--926 Machine Learning I (mini)

Core course on statistical machine learning for the [Master's in Computational Finance program](https://www.cmu.edu/mscf/), including regression, classification, and tree-based methods.

#### 36-460/660 Special Topics: Sports Analytics

Elective course for advanced undergraduate and [master's level](https://www.cmu.edu/dietrich/statistics-datascience/academics/mads/index.html) students on sports analytics methods, including multilevel models, Bayesian statistics, and spatio-temporal data.

#### 36--613 Data Visualization (mini)

Core course in [Master of Science in Applied Data Science (MADS)](https://www.cmu.edu/dietrich/statistics-datascience/academics/mads/index.html) on creating and understanding data visualizations and interactive tools from a statistical perspective.

#### 36-642 Telling Impactful Stories with Data Visualization (online mini)

Data visualization course in [Foundations of Data Science](https://www.cmu.edu/online/fds/) online graduate certificate program.

#### 36-493 Sports Analytics Capstone

Undergraduate capstone course using data provided by CMU athletics for sports analytics research projects.

#### 36-315 Statistical Graphics and Visualization

Undergraduate course on creating and understanding data visualizations from a statistical perspective.
